output.conclusion: Upon completion of this course, participants will possess a deep understanding of advanced power electronics concepts, enabling them to design, analyze, and optimize complex power electronic systems for various applications.
output.courseTitle: Advanced Power Electronics: Design and Applications
output.introduction: This course provides an in-depth exploration of advanced power electronics concepts and their applications in modern power systems. It is designed for engineers and researchers with a strong foundation in power electronics seeking to enhance their expertise in cutting-edge technologies and design methodologies.

chapters.chapterTitle: Wide Bandgap Devices: GaN and SiC
chapters.description: Explore the characteristics, advantages, and limitations of GaN and SiC power devices compared to traditional silicon devices. Discuss their impact on power converter efficiency, switching frequency, and thermal management.
Examine advanced PWM techniques, including space vector modulation (SVM) and carrier-based PWM, for improved harmonic performance and reduced switching losses in power converters.
Analyze zero-voltage switching (ZVS) and zero-current switching (ZCS) techniques for resonant converters. Discuss the design considerations and trade-offs involved in implementing soft-switching.

modules.moduleTitle: Advanced Power Semiconductor Devices and Modulation

chapters.description: Delve into the design of high-frequency transformers and inductors, including core material selection, winding techniques, and loss minimization strategies. Address skin effect and proximity effect considerations.

Explore advanced thermal management techniques for power electronic converters, including heat sink design, forced air cooling, liquid cooling, and thermal interface materials. Discuss thermal modeling and simulation.

Analyze electromagnetic interference (EMI) and electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) issues in power electronic converters. Discuss filtering techniques, shielding methods, and grounding strategies for mitigating EMI.

Examine the design and control of grid-connected inverters for renewable energy systems and active power filtering applications. Discuss synchronization techniques, grid codes, and power quality requirements.
Explore advanced DC-DC converter topologies, including resonant converters, soft-switching converters, and multi-level converters. Analyze their performance characteristics and design considerations.
Analyze advanced power factor correction (PFC) techniques for improving power quality and reducing harmonic distortion in AC-DC converters. Discuss active and passive PFC methods.

modules.moduleTitle: Advanced Power Converter Topologies and Applications

chapters.description: Explore digital control techniques for power electronic converters, including PID control, state-space control, and model predictive control. Discuss the implementation of digital controllers using microcontrollers and DSPs.

Analyze fault diagnosis and protection techniques for power electronic converters, including overcurrent protection, overvoltage protection, and thermal protection. Discuss fault detection algorithms and protection circuit design.
Examine reliability and lifetime prediction methods for power electronic converters. Discuss failure mechanisms, accelerated life testing, and reliability modeling techniques.
